document_title: Genital warts: Causes, signs, complications, prevention
subsection_content:
Human Papillomavirus (HPV) is the cause of genital warts. This virus includes about 150 strains with at least 40 strains transmitted through sexual contact. Among them, the two common strains that cause genital warts are HPV-16 and HPV-18, which are in the high-risk group, because they have the ability to cause cancer of the cervix, penis, vulva, vagina, anus, and pharynx. throat... HPV-6 and HPV-11 strains can also cause genital warts and recurrent respiratory papillomas, but do not progress to cancer. (2)
Risk factors for genital warts:
Most sexually active people will be infected with the virus at some point in their lives. Additionally, factors that may increase your risk of infection include:
Having sex without protection; Having sex without knowing your partner's sexual history; Having many sexual partners; Infection with other sexually transmitted diseases; Having sex early; Weak immune system such as HIV infection or taking anti-rejection drugs; People under 30 years old; Smoker; Have a mother infected with HPV virus
